TopicTitle: For crews, what do these lines in the save file mean?

Articles.Content:
CREW

{

name = Thompger Kerman

brave = 0.7771108

dumb = 0.7572525

badS = False

state = 0

ToD = 7671260.05305465

idx = 0

}

Let's say I wanted to add in my own pilot or edit an existing one. How can I do this? What do all these lines mean?

Edited September 18, 2012 by Spades_Neil
Typo in the title.

Hi, here you go :

name = well the name

brave = his level of braveness ( 0 >> 1)

dumb = his level of dumbness ( 0 >> 1 )

badS = i'm not sure, but Jeb has this at true so i assume it's a flag for "crazy" or "badaSs"?

state = 1 if it's in a ship, 0 otherwise

ToD = Time of death

idx = unique ID used to assign it to ships ( in "crew = ID" )

Cheers,

Now my next questions are how do braveness/dumbness affect behavior, and what does badS actually mean--because Jeb isn't the only one with this trait.
If you edit time of death on a dead kerbal does he come back to Life?

If you edit time of death on a dead kerbal does he come back to Life?

I believe this is only so the game can determine the lineup of who's next to be pilots when your kerbals die.

If you edit time of death on a dead kerbal does he come back to Life?

If a kerman is dead, all you need to do is change state = 3 to state = 0.
What gives them the orange jumpsuits? And can we have other colours? Would be handy for crews or job type.
Please don't necro old threads. The orange jumpsuits are assigned according to name only, and only given to Bill, Bob and Jeb.
